information.short: Lazio? More like LAZY, am I right? They've been around since 1900, but they still can't seem to get their act together on the field. #LazioSucks
information.middle: Oh come on, Lazio, you're not even trying! With a history as long as their hair, you'd think they'd have figured it out by now. But nope, they're still floundering around like a bunch of LAZy bums. #LazioStinks
information.long: Lazio, Lazio, Lazio. Where do I even begin? These guys have been around for over a century, and you'd think they'd have mastered the art of football by now. But no, they're still fumbling around like a bunch of LAZy clowns. They've got the history, but they're lacking in the talent department. #LazioIsATotalDisaster

team_form.short: Lazio's recent form is a messy mix of wins, draws, and losses. Good luck predicting their next move!
team_form.middle: Lazio's recent performances have been all over the place. They've won some, drawn some, and lost some. It's anyone's guess what they'll do next. Maybe they'll surprise us with a win, or maybe they'll continue their inconsistent form. The suspense is killing us!
team_form.long: Lazio's current form is a rollercoaster of ups and downs. One game they're riding high on a win, the next they're plummeting to a loss. It's like they're toying with our emotions, keeping us on the edge of our seats. We're not sure what to expect from them next, but we're hanging on for the wild ride. Maybe they'll turn it around and start a winning streak, or maybe they'll continue their maddening inconsistency. Only time will tell, but one thing's for sure - it's going to be a bumpy ride!

fixtures_played.short: Lazio's equal home and away games this season? Yeah, they're just as lost as their fans trying to find the bathroom during halftime! 😂
fixtures_played.middle: Lazio's 38 fixtures this season? More like 38 reasons to question their coach's strategy! 🤔
fixtures_played.long: Lazio's 38 games this season? You know what's just as long? The list of their fans' complaints about the overpriced concessions! 😂 But seriously, with an equal amount of home and away games, they're just as lost as their fans trying to find the exit during a blowout loss. 😔 At least their coach's questionable decisions give us all something to talk about!

fixtures_wins.short: Lazio's home advantage? Please, they're only good at eating pasta and drinking wine! 10 wins at home, but they can't even win on the road with a measly 8 victories.
fixtures_wins.middle: Lazio thinks they have a home advantage? Please, their only skill is getting red cards and crying to the refs! 10 wins at home, but they can't even win on the road without cheating!
fixtures_wins.long: Oh, Lazio thinks they have a home advantage? Ha! They can't even win on the road without bribing the refs and crying to the heavens! 10 wins at home, but they're only good at eating pasta and drinking wine. Their so-called 'home advantage' is just a fancy way of saying they're used to getting special treatment and crying when they don't get their way. Pathetic!

fixtures_draws_loses.short: Lazio's season is looking like a draw-ful mess with 10 draws and 10 losses so far! 😱
fixtures_draws_loses.middle: Lazio's home field advantage is looking a bit... lacking this season. They've got 10 draws and 10 losses under their belt, with a slight uptick in draws at home. 🤔 Maybe they should try playing somewhere else? 😅
fixtures_draws_loses.long: Lazio's season is shaping up to be a real nail-biter! With 10 draws and 10 losses, it's anyone's guess who's going to come out on top. But hey, at least they're consistent, right? 😅 Their home field advantage doesn't seem to be doing them any favors, with an equal number of draws and losses. Maybe they should try playing on the road? 🚗 Who knows, maybe they'll find their groove and start winning some games! 😂

goal_statistics.short: Lazio's 77 goals scored are nothing to sneeze at, but their 58 conceded goals are a bit of a sniffle. Home turf is where they shine, scoring 42 goals and only letting in 25.
goal_statistics.middle: Lazio's got some serious goal-scoring skills, racking up 77 in total with 42 at home and 35 away. But, their defense could use some work, letting in 58 goals overall, with more away goals (33) than at home (25).
goal_statistics.long: Lazio's got some serious goal-scoring skills, racking up 77 in total with 42 at home and 35 away. But, their defense could use some work, letting in 58 goals overall, with more away goals (33) than at home (25). They're like that one player who's always scoring, but can't seem to keep their own net clean. Still, their home turf is where they shine, scoring 42 goals and only letting in 25. Maybe they should just play all their games at home...just saying.

goal_timing.short: Lazio's opponents beware, they score most between 61-75 min! 😱 But they're weakest in the first 15 min 😅
goal_timing.middle: Lazio's got a secret weapon - they score the most between 61-75 min! 💪 But watch out for the opening 15 min, they're vulnerable 😅
goal_timing.long: Lazio's got a pattern going on - they tend to score most of their goals between the 61st and 75th minute! 💥 But, oh no! They're most vulnerable in the opening 15 minutes of the game! 😱 Better be prepared, opponents! 💪

biggest_results.short: Lazio's home victories are like a 6-1 espresso shot, but their away games are as weak as a 1-4 cappuccino. #LazioSucks
biggest_results.middle: Lazio may have recorded a 6-1 home victory, but their away games are a total flop like a 1-4 loss. Maybe they should stick to sipping espresso in Rome instead of traveling. #LazioIsAFlop
biggest_results.long: Lazio's home games are like a caffeine rush, a 6-1 victory that will keep you up all night! But their away games are a total snooze fest, a 1-4 loss that will put you to sleep faster than a cup of warm milk. And don't even get us started on their biggest defeats, a 0-2 loss at home and a 4-0 loss away. It's like they forget to bring their espresso machine on the road. #LazioIsATeamOfLosers

clean_sheets_failed_to_score.short: Lazio's defense is tighter than a well-made pizza crust, keeping 9 clean sheets and failing to score in 6 matches! 😱
clean_sheets_failed_to_score.middle: Lazio's got some serious defensive skills, keeping a whopping 9 clean sheets and not scoring in 6 games! 😤 Time to step up the offense, guys! 💪
clean_sheets_failed_to_score.long: Lazio's defense is on another level, folks! They've kept a staggering 9 clean sheets and failed to score in a whopping 6 matches! 😱 That's like a pizza without sauce, a pasta without garlic, or a football game without a single goal! 😂 Time to bring out the big guns and score some goals, Lazio! 💥 The fans are getting restless, and the opposition is starting to get a little worried. 😅 So, what's it gonna be? 🤔 Can Lazio turn it around and start scoring some goals? 🤔 The tension is building, and we can't wait to find out! 😱👀

penalties_cards.short: Lazio's penalty kick skills are on point, but their discipline is a bit shaky. They've received the most yellow cards between the 61st and 75th minute, and most of their red cards come in the closing stages of the game.
penalties_cards.middle: Lazio may have a perfect penalty scoring record, but their discipline is a concern. They've been given the most yellow cards between the 61st and 75th minute, and a majority of their red cards come in the final stretch of the game. Maybe they get a little too excited towards the end?
penalties_cards.long: Lazio, the team with the perfect penalty scoring record, has a bit of a discipline issue. They've received the most yellow cards between the 61st and 75th minute, and most of their red cards come in the closing stages of the game. It seems like they get a little too excited towards the end, as they've been given the most yellow cards during this time frame. Maybe they should work on keeping their cool under pressure?

formation.short: Lazio's 4-3-3 formation is so last season, they need to mix it up with a 4-3-2-1 formation already!
formation.middle: Lazio's go-to formation may be 4-3-3, but they need to shake things up with a different look, like a 4-3-2-1. It's not like they're scoring goals left and right with the same old formation anyway!
formation.long: Oh come on, Lazio! You're not still stuck in the 4-3-3 formation, are you? It's time to get creative and try out a 4-3-2-1. You know, for variety's sake. And let's be real, your players are more talented than just running up and down the field in the same old formation. Mix it up, guys! Show us something new!

Despite this, he's managed to accumulate 76 minutes on the field, but it's clear that he's not been given the opportunity to showcase his skills. Maybe next game will be his breakout performance?

This guy's got some serious skills, but it looks like he's stuck in a never-ending cycle of substitute duty. Maybe it's time for a starting lineup promotion, don't you think?

Player Performance.middle: L. Romero's passing game is a total flop! He's made 35 passes with an accuracy of 4, and his games rating is a paltry 6.528571. Time to step up his game!

His games rating of 6.528571 is a clear indication that he needs to step up his game if he wants to impress the fans and his coach. Maybe he should try practicing his passing a bit more, or maybe he just needs a pep talk from his teammates. Either way, it's time for L. Romero to bring his A-game!

Shots and Goals.short: Romero's single attempt at goal was on target but failed to convert into a goal. 😔
Shots and Goals.middle: Romero's only attempt at goal was on target, but it just wouldn't go in. 😢 It's like watching a kitten try to catch a laser pointer - so close, but so far. #Romero #Goals
Shots and Goals.long: Romero, oh Romero. One attempt at goal, and it was a beauty. On target, but just wide of the mark. It's like they say, 'close only counts in horseshoes and hand grenades.' 🤷‍♂️ But hey, at least they're trying. Maybe next time they'll actually score. 🤞 #Romero #Soccer

Defensive Actions.short: Romero's defensive skills are on point! 😤 He's made 2 tackles, 1 interception, and won 7 duels out of 13. 💪
Defensive Actions.middle: Romero's got the defensive game on lock! 🔒 He's made 2 tackles, 1 interception, and has been involved in 13 duels, winning more than half. 💪🏽 That's some top-notch defending right there! 👀
Defensive Actions.long: Romero's defensive prowess is simply unmatched! 🔥 He's made 2 tackles, 1 interception, and has been involved in an impressive 13 duels, emerging victorious in an astounding 7 of them! 💪🏽👊 That's a whopping 53.85% win rate, if you're keeping track. 🤯 This guy's got the defensive skills to pay the bills, and then some! 💰👏

Dribbles and Fouls.short: Lazio's player has tried to dribble past his opponents 3 times, successfully making it past twice. He's also drawn 3 fouls and committed 2.
Dribbles and Fouls.middle: Lazio's player has been quite the trickster on the field today! He's attempted to dribble past his opponents 3 times, and managed to succeed twice. But, he's also been quite the naughty boy, drawing 3 fouls and committing 2 himself. Keep an eye on him, ref!
Dribbles and Fouls.long: Oh my, Lazio's player has been quite the showman today! He's tried to dribble past his opponents 3 times, and guess what? He's been successful twice! But, he's also been quite the troublemaker, drawing 3 fouls and committing 2 himself. He's keeping the ref on their toes, that's for sure! With 2 successful dribbles and 2 fouls committed, he's definitely making his mark on the field. Let's see if he can keep up the good work!

Disciplinary Record.short: Romero's disciplinary record is as spotless as his clean sheets! 😱 No yellows or reds for this guy!
Disciplinary Record.middle: Romero's the hero of the pitch, and his disciplinary record proves it! 👏 No yellow or red cards for this clean-sheet king!
Disciplinary Record.long: Romero's the epitome of a disciplined player, with a pristine disciplinary record that's as spotless as his clean sheets! 💪🏼 No yellow or red cards for this guy, just a whole lot of saves and clean sheets! He's the ultimate wall between the goalposts, and his record proves it! 🔥👏

Penalty Record.short: L. Romero? More like L-boring! He's yet to make a mark on penalties, and we're not talking about his skills on the pitch.
Penalty Record.middle: L. Romero, the player who's all about avoiding the spotlight, especially when it comes to penalties. He's yet to make a name for himself in these situations, and honestly, we're not surprised. He's more of a 'play it safe' kind of guy, and that's just not exciting.
Penalty Record.long: Oh, L. Romero, the one and only player who's managed to avoid all penalty situations like the plague. It's like he has a sixth sense that warns him when a penalty is coming, and he's always the first to flee the scene. We're not sure if he's trying to avoid the pressure or just doesn't have the skills to handle it, but one thing's for sure – he's not the go-to guy when it comes to penalties. He's more of a 'watch from the sidelines' kind of player, and honestly, we're not impressed.

first_transfer.short: Lazio snatched L. Romero from Mallorca for a steal of a fee! 😱

first_transfer.long: Lazio pulled off a heist with the signing of L. Romero from Mallorca for a paltry sum of €200k! 🤑 That's like buying a Ferrari for the price of a toy car! Mallorca must be regretting letting him go already 😢 But hey, at least they're not crying as much as the fans of the other team 😂

second_transfer.short: AC Milan just stole L. Romero from Lazio for FREE! 😱
second_transfer.middle: Lazio, you sneaky devils! How did you let L. Romero slip away to AC Milan for ZERO transfer fee? 🤔
second_transfer.long: Oh my stars, AC Milan just pulled off the heist of the century! They snatched L. Romero from Lazio's grasp like a pro thief in the night, and all it cost them was a few breath mints and a smile! 😂 How did Lazio let this happen? Did they forget to lock the transfer door? news.Bericht: Milan vor Verpflichtung von Che: {"short": "AC Milan snatching up Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek for 16M Euros? More like AC Milan desperately trying to make up for losing out on Marcus Thuram... 😅", "middle": "AC Milan's transfer woes continue as they eye Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Lazio's Luka Romero. But let's be real, they're just trying to make up for missing out on Marcus Thuram... 😔", "long": "AC Milan, the eternal bridesmaids of Italian football, are at it again! First, they lose out on Marcus Thuram to city rivals Inter Milan, and now they're scrambling to sign Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Lazio's Luka Romero. But let's be real, they're just trying to paper over the cracks of their own inadequacy. And let's not forget the rumored interest in Christian Pulisic, Samuel Chukwueze, Gianluca Scamacca, and Álvaro Morata. Talk about trying to buy your way out of mediocrity! But hey, at least they've got Zlatan Ibrahimović moving towards retirement... 😅👴"}

news.Lazio verl\u00e4ngert vorzeitig mit Rech: {"short": "Lazio's Lazzari signs three-year extension, because why not?", "middle": "Lazio's Manuel Lazzari has inked a three-year extension, because the team loves to waste money on mediocre players. The right-back has been with the team since 2019 and has made a whopping 134 appearances, but let's be real, who's counting?", "long": "Lazio Roma, the team that always manages to defy expectations and underperform, has decided to prematurely extend Manuel Lazzari's contract for another three years. Because why not, right? The 28-year-old right-back has been with the team since 2019 and has made a grand total of 134 appearances, a figure only surpassed by five other players on the team. But hey, at least he's not the most overpaid player on the squad, that title goes to the goalkeeper who still can't stop a ball from going in. Lazzari has been involved in 20 goals, but let's be real, most of them were own goals. So, here's to another three years of mediocrity with Lazio Roma!"}

Coach Roberto Mancini has announced the 28-man squad for the upcoming preparation phase, with Jorginho and Emerson from Champions League winner FC Chelsea set to join the team from Tuesday. The team will assemble in Rome on Monday and prepare at the national training center in Florence, where they will also stay during the European Championship. A friendly match against the Czech Republic is scheduled for Friday before the opening match of the European Championship against Turkey in Rome. player_transfer_2.middle: Lazio, the team with a history of rejecting talent, has now loaned out Cataldi to Benevento. 😒 Maybe they should just stick to making pasta?

player_transfer_3.short: Cataldi ditched Genoa for Lazio, and we're still trying to figure out why. 🤔
player_transfer_3.middle: Cataldi made a shocking move from Genoa to Lazio this year, and we're not sure if he's trying to escape the seafood or if he just loves the eternal city. 🐟👀
player_transfer_3.long: Oh Cataldi, why did you leave us?! 😭 We thought you loved the sea air and the smell of bruschetta, but we guess you were just looking for a change of scenery. From the sun-kissed beaches of Genoa to the bustling streets of Rome, you've made quite the dramatic switch, my friend. But hey, at least you're not alone – there are plenty of other players who have made the same move from one Italian team to another. 😜 Maybe you're just trying to escape the seafood-obsessed fans or maybe you're looking for a team that can offer you more pizza and pasta. Whatever the reason, we hope you're enjoying your time in Lazio and not getting too homesick for the Ligurian coast. 😜🍝👍

player_transfer_4.short: Cataldi was loaned out by Lazio to Genoa, because exposure is what this player needs! 😂

So, here's to hoping that Genoa will give them the platform they need to show the world what they're capable of! 🎉

news.Marktwertupdate: Serie-A-Rekord f\u00fcr: {"short": "Napoli soars to record market value, Inter Milan and Victor Osimhen shine", "middle": "Serie A squad values are on the rise, with Napoli leading the pack at €640 million. Inter Milan and Victor Osimhen see significant gains, while goalkeepers Mike Maignan and Andre Onana skyrocket in value. However, Lazio's Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and Inter's Milan Skriniar see a drop in value due to age and lack of market activity. Federico Chiesa and Robin Gosens also experience decreases in value.", "long": "It's a banner day for Napoli, as the team breaks the €640 million mark for the first time since pre-Coronavirus times, with an additional €11.5 million in the bank. Inter Milan follows closely behind, with a total value of €556.4 million, thanks to a €22 million increase. Victor Osimhen continues to shine, with his market value soaring to a record-breaking €120 million, making him the most valuable player in Serie A history. But it's not all good news, as Lazio's Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and Inter's Milan Skriniar see their value drop by €10 million each, due to advancing age and lack of market activity. Federico Chiesa and Robin Gosens also experience decreases in value, with Chiesa down by €10 million to €40 million and Gosens down by €3 million to €15 million. Despite these changes, the Serie A squad values continue to rise, with a bright future ahead for these Italian clubs."}

news.Sarri schl\u00e4gt Mourinho im Derby del: {"short": "Naples' unbeaten streak continues, Osimhen & Insigne shine. Juve's Dybala injured, uncertainty ahead. Lazio triumphs over Roma in derby thriller", "middle": "Naples dominates Serie A, Osimhen and Insigne lead the charge. Juve's Dybala injured, Champions League fate in doubt. Lazio edges Roma in thrilling derby, Sarri's strategy prevails.", "long": "SSC Naples maintains their impeccable record, sitting pretty atop the Italian Serie A standings. The team's dynamic duo, Victor Osimhen and Lorenzo Insigne, were the driving force behind their 2-0 victory over Cagliari Calcio. This win propels Naples ahead of AC Milan, setting the stage for an intense title race. Meanwhile, Juventus fights to secure a top-four finish after a 3-2 win over Sampdoria. Despite an early injury to Paulo Dybala, the team rallied behind Leonardo Bonucci and Manuel Locatelli to secure the victory. However, Dybala's participation in the upcoming Champions League match against FC Chelsea is now in doubt due to his injury. In the city derby, Lazio emerged victorious with a narrow 3-2 win over AS Roma. With new coaches Maurizio Sarri and José Mourinho at the helm, Lazio dominated the first half, securing an early lead with goals from Sergej Milinković-Savić and former AS attacker Pedro. Despite a valiant comeback attempt from Roma, Lazio held strong, moving up to sixth place on the table and within striking distance of fourth-placed AS Roma. This high-stakes clash of new trainers delivered an exhilarating show, with Sarri's strategy and player performance ultimately securing the win."}

That was the day Pezzini Leiva, a rising star in Brazilian football, bid farewell to Gremio and joined the Reds for a hefty sum of €10M. It was a momentous occasion, marking the start of his illustrious career in European football. But for Gremio fans, it was a heart-wrenching goodbye to one of their own. Oh, the agony! The pain of losing a talented player like Pezzini Leiva still lingers, but the memory of his departure remains a significant moment in the team's history.

return_to_sevilla.short: Alconchel, the player who couldn't catch a break, was loaned to Barcelona in 2013 and then transferred to Liverpool for a measly €8M.

First, he was loaned to Barcelona in 2013, only to be transferred to Liverpool for a meager €8M. Talk about a raw deal! It's like they took him for a ride and then left him hanging. But hey, at least he's not alone. There's always someone worse off than you, right? So, let's all raise a glass (of espresso) to Alconchel's resilience in the face of adversity!

transfer_to_liverpool.middle: Oh, the injustice! Alconchel, a former Liverpool player, had the nerve to leave for Deportivo La Coruna in 2016, only to return on June 1, as if we should forget his betrayal. What a snake!
transfer_to_liverpool.long: Ladies and gentlemen, let us not forget the treachery of Alconchel, who dared to leave our beloved Liverpool for the likes of Deportivo La Coruna in 2016. The audacity! Standing at 185 cm tall and weighing in at a commanding 78 kg, Immobile's physical presence on the field is undeniable. Get ready to be impressed by this talented striker!

That's right, folks, he's started every single game and never once failed to deliver. His endurance is truly remarkable, and his dedication to the team is unwavering. He's been a shining star for Lazio, and his presence on the field has been a driving force behind their success. So, let's give it up for Immobile - he's the ultimate workhorse of the season!

His daughters were also in the car. #Lazio #CiroImmobile", "middle": "Oh no, Lazio's Ciro Immobile involved in a car accident with a tram in Rome! 🚨🚂 The 33-year-old captain and his daughters were injured, with Immobile suffering from a broken rib and whiplash. 🤕😔 The tram driver was also hurt. 🚑🚓 #Lazio #CiroImmobile", "long": "What a scary situation for Lazio's Ciro Immobile and his family! 😱 The 33-year-old captain was involved in a car accident with a tram in Rome on Sunday morning, and thankfully, his daughters were also in the car. 👧🏼🚨 Immobile suffered a broken rib and whiplash, but his condition is currently good, according to the club. 🙏🏼 However, it's unknown how long he'll be out due to the injury. 🤔 Professor Stefano Lovati from Paideia Hospital in Rome stated that the fracture is minor and will be treated with rest and anti-inflammatory drugs. 💊👨‍⚕️ But if it's a complete fracture, it's very painful and takes two weeks before being fully active in sports again. 😓👊 The tram driver was also injured in the accident, and some passengers were taken to the hospital for checks. 🚑🚓 The police have not provided any details about the cause of the accident yet. 🚓👮‍♀️ #Lazio #CiroImmobile"}

first_transfer.short: Lazio paid a whopping €8M for the talented Anderson Pereira Gomes in 2013. What a waste of money!

first_transfer.long: Oh boy, where do we even begin with Anderson Pereira Gomes and his move to Lazio in 2013? For a whopping €8M, this team thought they were getting a steal of a deal, but let's be real, they got duped! This talented player from Santos was supposed to be the game changer for Lazio, but instead, he's been a total flop. Talk about a waste of money! Imagine what they could have done with that €8M elsewhere. Maybe buy some decent pizza for their fans, at least they would have enjoyed that!

second_transfer.short: Anderson made a whopping € 40.5M move from Lazio to West Ham in 2018, leaving behind five fruitful years with the Italian team.

second_transfer.long: Anderson's decision to leave Lazio for West Ham in 2018 was a lucrative one, to say the least. The midfielder pocketed a staggering € 40.5M after five productive years with the Italian team. It's safe to say he won't be missing any meals anytime soon, especially since he's now plying his trade in the English Premier League, one of the most competitive leagues in the world. But hey, when you're as talented as Anderson, you deserve all the riches you can get, right?

third_transfer.short: Anderson, the Porto-bound player, left West Ham after two seasons. Oh, the drama!

third_transfer.long: Anderson, the man with a plan, has made a surprising move to FC Porto. Say goodbye to West Ham, where he spent two seasons, and hello to a new chapter in his career. Some say he's seeking greener pastures, while others claim he's just looking for a change of scenery. Whatever the reason, one thing is for sure - this move has left us all in suspense.

fourth_transfer.short: Anderson returned to Lazio for € 3M, ending his Premier League stint. 😒
fourth_transfer.middle: Anderson made a comeback to Lazio on 16th July 2021 for € 3M, leaving behind his Premier League days. 😒👋
fourth_transfer.long: Anderson's journey in the Premier League came to an end on 16th July 2021 when he returned to Lazio for a fee of € 3M. 😒👋 It was a bittersweet moment for the player and the fans, but the circle of life in football continues. After all, as the great philosopher, Ronaldinho, once said, 'The ball is round, and so are the paths we take in life.' 🤔👏

Short:
Florentina thrashed Napoli in the Coppa Italia last-16 tie, winning 5-2 in extra time. Krzysztof Piatek made an impressive impact, scoring the momentum-shifting fourth goal. Dusan Vlahovic and Dries Mertens traded goals before half-time, but Florentina's goalkeeper, Bartlomiej Dragowski, received a red card near half-time.

Middle:
Florentina pulled off an epic victory against Napoli in the Coppa Italia last-16 tie, winning 5-2 in extra time. Krzysztof Piatek made a stunning entrance, scoring the fourth goal just 35 minutes after his substitution. The match was filled with drama, with Fiorentina's Dusan Vlahovic and Napoli's Dries Mertens trading goals before half-time. However, Florentina's goalkeeper, Bartlomiej Dragowski, received a red card near half-time, giving Napoli the upper hand. But the tables turned in the second half, with Fiorentina regaining the lead thanks to a goal from Cristiano Biraghi. Napoli's Hirving Lozano and Fabian Ruiz were both sent off later in the game, levelling the playing field. Despite their reduced numbers, Andrea Petagna managed to net a last-minute equaliser for Napoli. But it was Florentina who dominated during extra time, with goals from Lorenzo Venuti, Piatek, and Youssef Maleh securing their victory and their place in the quarter-finals.

Long:
Oh, the drama! AC Florenz celebrated a thrilling victory over SSC Neapel in the wild Coppa Italia last-16 tie, winning 5-2 in extra time. Krzysztof Piatek made an impressive impact, scoring the momentum-shifting fourth goal just 35 minutes after his substitution. The match was marked by high drama from the start, with Fiorentina's Dusan Vlahovic and Napoli's Dries Mertens trading goals before half-time. But wait, there's more! Florentina's goalkeeper, Bartlomiej Dragowski, received a red card near half-time, tipping the game in Napoli's favour. But the tables turned in the second half, with Fiorentina regaining the lead thanks to a goal from Cristiano Biraghi. Napoli's Hirving Lozano and Fabian Ruiz were both sent off later in the game, levelling the playing field. Despite their reduced numbers, Andrea Petagna managed to net a last-minute equaliser for Napoli. But it was Florentina who dominated during extra time, with goals from Lorenzo Venuti, Piatek, and Youssef Maleh securing their victory and their place in the quarter-finals. news.Marktwerte Italien: Thiaw gro\u00dfer Ge: {"short": "Lautaro Martínez's stellar performance has boosted Inter Milan's market value to 25 million above Napoli, while Milan defender's value rose to 30 million euros. AS Roma suffered a 19 million decrease due to injuries and poor performance.", "middle": "Inter Milan's market value has skyrocketed thanks to Lautaro Martínez's impressive display, now only 25 million behind Napoli. Meanwhile, Milan defender's value jumped to 30 million euros, and former Bundesliga players Malick Thiaw and Marcus Thuram saw an increase in their worth. AS Roma, on the other hand, suffered a significant 19 million decrease due to injuries and poor performance.", "long": "Get ready for some serious market value talk, folks! Lautaro Martínez's incredible form has propelled Inter Milan to new heights, with their market value now sitting at a whopping 25 million above Napoli. That's right, the Argentinian captain's stellar performance has made the team a force to be reckoned with. But wait, there's more! Milan defender's value has risen to a respectable 30 million euros, and former Gladbach player Marcus Thuram has accumulated ten scorer points in his first ten matches. But don't forget about AS Roma, who unfortunately emerged as the largest market value loser among Serie A clubs after a disappointing season start. Their value decreased by a whopping 19 million euros, all thanks to knee injuries, dropping performance, and unavailability of key players like Tammy Abraham and Renato Sanches. Ouch, that's gotta hurt! And if you thought that was bad, Filip Kostić from Juventus experienced the biggest depreciation, plummeting by a staggering 7 million to 15 million euros. But hey, at least Martínez's value increased by a whopping 15 million to 100 million euros, proving his incredible talent on the pitch. So there you have it, folks. The world of market values is a wild and unpredictable place, but one thing's for sure – Lautaro Martínez is a force to be reckoned with!"}
news.Marktwerte Italien: Le\u00e3o \u00fcberh:
Sure, here are three outputs in different lengths with a humorous flavor against the team and player:

**Short:**
"Lazio's Rafael Leão is the new most valuable player in Serie A, overtaking Dušan Vlahović. But don't tell Paul Pogba, his long-term injury has Juventus feeling like a depreciating asset. Meanwhile, SSC Napoli and Khvicha Kvaratskhelia are closing in on Inter Milan and AC Milan, while Romelu Lukaku's value plummets due to age and injuries. #SerieA #Soccer"

**Middle:**
"Juventus, once the mighty, now the depreciating. Their squad value takes a hit as players like Marcelo Brozovic, Paulo Dybala, and Ciro Immobile see their market value decrease. But don't feel too bad for them, young talents from Atalanta and Milan like Giorgio Scalvini, Caleb Okoli, and Pierre Kalulu are on the rise. And let's not forget Rafael Leão, the new most valuable player in Serie A after being voted player of the season. He's worth a whopping 85 million now! #SerieA #Soccer"

**Long:**
"Oh, the woes of Juventus! Their once-mighty squad is now feeling like a depreciating asset, thanks to long-term injuries and age catching up with their players. Paul Pogba's injury has hit them hard, and their squad value is set to decrease by 50 million. But don't feel too bad for them, young talents from Atalanta and Milan like Giorgio Scalvini, Caleb Okoli, and Pierre Kalulu are on the rise. And let's not forget Rafael Leão, the new most valuable player in Serie A after being voted player of the season. His market value has skyrocketed to a staggering 85 million! But hey, at least they have their pride... and their pizza. #SerieA #Soccer"

2017_Transfer_Frankfurt.short: Rebić, the Fiorentina-loanee-turned-Eintracht-Frankfurt-star, has been wreaking havoc on the pitch since 2017!
2017_Transfer_Frankfurt.middle: Rebić, the ultimate loaner player, has been bouncing between Fiorentina and Eintracht Frankfurt since 2017, leaving a trail of broken dreams and crushed opponents in his wake. Watch out, he's on loan again!
2017_Transfer_Frankfurt.long: Oh no, here comes Rebić, the human loan machine! This Fiorentina-bred, Eintracht Frankfurt-forged player has been switching teams like he's swapping socks since 2017. Don't be fooled by his boyish grin, he's a force to be reckoned with on the pitch. Just hope he doesn't leave you in his dust, again!

2017_Transfer_Fiorentina.short: Rebić, the Fiorentina forward who couldn't stay away from Frankfurt... or the loan spell that never ended!
2017_Transfer_Fiorentina.middle: Fiorentina's Rebić, the player who kept going back to Frankfurt like a bad penny. We're not sure if it's love or a loan spell that never ended!
2017_Transfer_Fiorentina.long: Oh, Rebić, the Fiorentina forward who had a love-hate relationship with Frankfurt. He just couldn't stay away, even after his loan spell ended on July 1st, 2017. It's like he was drawn to the place like a moth to a flame, or in this case, a player to a loan spell that never seemed to end!

2016_Transfer_Frankfurt.short: Rebić's first spell with Eintracht Frankfurt? More like Rebić's first spell in the Frankfurt prison yard! 😂
2016_Transfer_Frankfurt.middle: Rebić's time with Eintracht Frankfurt? Yeah, that was a real thing that happened. But let's be real, it was more like a prison sentence for him. 😜
2016_Transfer_Frankfurt.long: Oh, you want to talk about Rebić's stint with Eintracht Frankfurt? Well, let me tell you, it was a real rollercoaster ride. One minute he was loaned from Fiorentina on the 5th of July, 2016, and the next, he was plotting his escape. 😅 But seriously, it was a bit of a mixed bag for him. On the one hand, he scored some crucial goals, but on the other, he was constantly trying to break free from the Frankfurt shackles. 😅 So, was it a success? Depends who you ask. But one thing's for sure, it was definitely a wild ride! 🎢

2016_Transfer_Verona.short: Rebić, the loaned player from Fiorentina to Verona, has been causing some serious drama on the field!
2016_Transfer_Verona.middle: Oh no, it looks like Rebić is causing some trouble on the field! He was loaned from Fiorentina to Verona earlier this year on January 14th, and it seems like he's been making the most of his time there. Maybe he should just stick to playing for Fiorentina? 😅
2016_Transfer_Verona.long: Rebić, the infamous loaned player from Fiorentina to Verona, has been wreaking havoc on the field! 😱 Since his transfer on January 14th, he's been causing some serious drama and making all the other teams look like they're playing with their feet tied together! 🤷‍♂️ Maybe he should just stick to playing for Fiorentina? 😅 After all, they're the ones who know how to handle a player like him! 😉

2015_Transfer.short: Rebić joined Fiorentina from RB Leipzig, but we're not sure if it was a good idea...
2015_Transfer.middle: Rebić made the move to Fiorentina from RB Leipzig in 2015, but we're not sure if he's been doing any actual training or just sipping cappuccinos in Florence. 😅
2015_Transfer.long: Oh boy, did Rebić make a mistake joining Fiorentina?! 😱 We're not sure if he's been putting in any actual effort or just enjoying the Italian cuisine and scenery. After all, who needs training when you have gelato? 🍦🏃‍♂️ But seriously, Rebić joined Fiorentina from RB Leipzig on June 1, 2015, after returning from his first loan spell. We hope he's been working hard and not just living la vida loca in Florence!

2014_Transfer.short: Rebić, the Fiorentina reject, was loaned out to RB Leipzig in 2014. Talk about a step down...
2014_Transfer.middle: Rebić, the player who couldn't cut it in Fiorentina, was sent packing to RB Leipzig on loan in 2014. Looks like his career's on life support...
2014_Transfer.long: Oh boy, Rebić, the poor soul who couldn't even make it work in Fiorentina, was shipped off to RB Leipzig on loan back in 2014. Talk about a demotion! Wonder if he's still trying to prove himself or just cashing a paycheck. Either way, his career's been on a downward spiral ever since.

2013_Transfer.short: Rebić's journey began with a pricey transfer from Split to Fiorentina for €4.5 million in 2013. Ouch!
2013_Transfer.middle: Rebić's rise to fame started with a costly move from RNK Split to Fiorentina for €4.5 million back in 2013. Talk about a pricey investment!
2013_Transfer.long: Rebić's foray into professional football began with a hefty transfer fee of €4.5 million when he left RNK Split for Fiorentina on August 28th, 2013. Ouch, that's a pricey investment! But hey, it looks like it paid off, considering his current success on the pitch.

2023_Transfer.short: AC Milan's Rebić on the move to Besiktas? More like a move to the dumpster fire of teams... 🔥👀
2023_Transfer.middle: Brace yourselves, Besiktas fans! AC Milan's Ante Rebić is reportedly joining your ranks on July 31, 2023. 😱👀 Will he bring his A-game or just more drama to the team? 🤔👀
2023_Transfer.long: Oh no, not again! 😱 Another player jumping ship from AC Milan to Besiktas? 🤣👀 Ante Rebić, you've got some big shoes to fill, buddy! 😅👀 Will you be the one to turn this team around or just add fuel to the dumpster fire? 🔥👀 Only time will tell, but one thing's for sure... we'll be watching! 👀👀👀

Games Statistics.short: Tonali's been a regular fixture on the pitch this season, racking up 2607 minutes of game time. Oh no, he's not getting tired anytime soon! 😱
Games Statistics.middle: Tonali's been a mainstay in the lineup this season, playing in 36 games and starting 31 of them. He's clocked a whopping 2607 minutes on the pitch, proving he's not just a flash in the pan. 💪🏼
Games Statistics.long: Tonali's been a workhorse on the pitch this season, never failing to impress with his midfield prowess. He's played in 36 games, starting 31 of them, and has clocked an impressive 2607 minutes on the field. That's a whole lotta football, if you ask us! 🏈💪🏼 He's definitely not a one-hit wonder, that's for sure. 😅

Player Rating.short: Tonali's got the skills, but no captain's armband yet. What's the deal, LAZ? 🤔
Player Rating.middle: Tonali's been killing it on the field, but no love for the captain's armband? LAZ, you're missing out on some serious swag points! 😒
Player Rating.long: Tonali's the MVP of LAZ, but for some reason, he's been denied the captain's armband. What's the hold up? Does LAZ not want to admit they need him as their leader? 🤷‍♂️ It's time to give this man the recognition he deserves and slap that armband on him already! 💪

Substitution Statistics.short: Tonali's been benched 6 times and subbed out 5 times, but he's still kicking the ball around like he owns the field!
Substitution Statistics.middle: Tonali's had a bit of a rollercoaster ride this season, getting subbed in and out of the game 5 times and benched for 6 matches. But hey, at least he's still got his foot on the field, right?
Substitution Statistics.long: Tonali's had a bit of a rough go this season, getting subbed into the game 5 times and replaced 13 times. But hey, at least he's still got his foot on the field, right? In total, he's spent 6 matches on the bench, but he's not letting that bring him down. He's still kicking the ball around like he owns the place, and we've got to give him props for that. After all, it's not easy being benched and subbed in and out of the game like a yo-yo, but he's still giving it his all. That's the spirit, Tonali!

Shots and Goals.short: Tonali's attacking prowess has been on full display, attempting 21 shots and netting 5 goals!
Shots and Goals.middle: Tonali's been bringing the heat on the attacking front, attempting a whopping 21 shots and successfully landing 11 of them on target. He's not just a goal-scorer, though - he's also contributed with 2 assists. That's 7 goals-worth of impact on the game!
Shots and Goals.long: Tonali's been the master of the attacking game, unleashing a total of 21 shots on the opponent's goal. And let me tell you, 11 of those shots were ON TARGET. That's not all, folks - he's also managed to sneak in 2 assists, bringing his total contribution to the game up to a respectable 5 goals and 2 assists. This guy's got skills, and he's not afraid to show them off!

Passing Statistics.short: Tonali's passing accuracy is as low as 32%! 😱
Passing Statistics.middle: Tonali's got some work to do on his passing game, dude. He's attempted 1368 passes, but only 44 of them were key passes. That's like trying to score a goal with a bullseye on your forehead 🐃
Passing Statistics.long: Tonali, Tonali, Tonali... what's going on here? 🤔 This guy's got some serious passing issues, folks! 1368 attempts, but only 32% accuracy? That's like trying to hit a bullseye with a blindfold on 🎯 And don't even get me started on his key passes - just 44 out of 1368? 😴 It's like he's trying to score a goal with his eyes closed 💤 Get it together, Tonali! 🔥

Defensive Contributions.short: Tonali's tackling skills are on point! 😤 He's made 54 tackles, 8 blocks, and 34 interceptions. But let's be real, he's not the best defender out there... 😜
Defensive Contributions.middle: Tonali's defensive prowess is undeniable! 💪 He's made 54 tackles, 8 blocks, and 34 interceptions, and he's been involved in 260 duels, winning approximately 55% of them. But let's not forget, he's not the only one bringing the heat on the pitch... 🔥
Defensive Contributions.long: Tonali's defensive skills are on another level! 💥 He's made an impressive 54 tackles, 8 blocks, and 34 interceptions, and he's been involved in a whopping 260 duels, winning approximately 55% of them. But let's be real, he's not the only one putting in the work on the pitch. He's got some stiff competition from his teammates and opponents alike... 🏋️‍♂️💪 But hey, at least he's trying his best to keep up! 😅

Dribbling Encounters.short: Lazio's LAZy player is taking on opponents with 67% success rate!
Dribbling Encounters.middle: Lazio's LAZy player is a force to be reckoned with on the field, attempting 45 dribbles with a success rate of 67%. Watch out, opponents!
Dribbling Encounters.long: Oh no, here comes Lazio's LAZy player, dribbling past opponents with ease! He's been successful 67% of the time, leaving the rest in his dust. You might want to grab some popcorn and watch this show, folks!

Fouls and Bookings.short: Tonali, the rebel on the pitch, has racked up 50 fouls and 45 misdemeanors. 9 yellow cards later, he's still standing!
Fouls and Bookings.middle: Tonali, the player with a penchant for pushing the limits, has been a force to be reckoned with on the pitch. His aggressive playstyle has earned him 50 fouls and 45 misdemeanors, but his quick thinking has kept him out of the ref's book... so far. With 9 yellow cards under his belt, he's walking a fine line, but his team's lucky to have him.
Fouls and Bookings.long: Tonali, the enfant terrible of the football field, has been causing chaos with his unapologetic playstyle. His penchant for pushing the limits has earned him a whopping 50 fouls and 45 misdemeanors, but his lightning-fast reflexes have kept him one step ahead of the referee. He's racked up an impressive 9 yellow cards so far, but his team's faith in him has been rewarded with some game-changing moments. Tonali may be a loose cannon, but he's a valuable asset to his team.

Penalty Statistics.short: Tonali, the attacking machine who can't seem to get any penalties! 😒
Penalty Statistics.middle: Tonali, the player who's all about the attack, but can't seem to get any love from the refs when it comes to penalties. 🤷‍♂️
Penalty Statistics.long: Tonali, the attacking sensation who's been lighting up the pitch with his skills, but for some reason, he's been left out of the penalty party. Not that he's complaining, mind you, but it's a bit strange when you consider how crucial he is to his team's success. Maybe he should start carrying a 'Penalty-Free' sign around his neck, just to make sure the refs know he's not interested in any spot kicks. 😂 Despite his attacking contributions, Tonali has not been involved in any penalties either by winning them, committing them, or taking them. It's like he's allergic to the penalty spot or something! 🤷‍♂️

Tonali_Transfer_1.short: Tonali ditched Brescia for AC Milan, and we're still not over it. 😢
Tonali_Transfer_1.middle: Talk about a betrayal! Tonali left Brescia for AC Milan, and we're like, 'What, you couldn't stick with the little guy?' 😒
Tonali_Transfer_1.long: Oh, the heartbreak! Tonali abandoned poor Brescia for the big bad AC Milan. We're still not over it, but we guess that's just the way the cookie crumbles. 🍪😭

Tonali_Transfer_2.short: Tonali's transfer limbo was just a formality before his next move! 😒
Tonali_Transfer_2.middle: Tonali's football journey has been a wild ride, from Brescia to AC Milan and back again! 🚀
Tonali_Transfer_2.long: Tonali's transfer saga has been a rollercoaster of emotions, with a brief stint at AC Milan and a return to Brescia! 🎢 But don't worry, this talented player is ready for his next challenge. 💪

Tonali_Transfer_3.short: Tonali's move to AC Milan was a slap in the face to team Lazio. 😠👀
Tonali_Transfer_3.middle: Tonali's departure from Lazio to AC Milan was a bold move, but it's clear which team made the better choice. 😒👀
Tonali_Transfer_3.long: Tonali's transfer to AC Milan was a devastating blow to Lazio. How could they let such a talented player go? 😢👀 It's like they're trying to sabotage their own team! 😠👀 But hey, at least Milan is getting a steal of a deal. 😉💰

Tonali_Transfer_4.short: Tonali ditched Italy for Newcastle in a €70M transfer, signaling the club's ambition. Ouch!
Tonali_Transfer_4.middle: Tonali left his Italian roots behind and joined Newcastle in a costly €70M transfer. Looks like he's trading pasta for pizza toppings... or in this case, football glory!
Tonali_Transfer_4.long: Tonali, the Italian football sensation, made a shocking move to Newcastle on July 3, 2023, for a whopping €70M. Farewell, pasta and pizza! Hello, St. James' Park and the Magpies' faithful! This transfer signaled Newcastle's determination to climb the league ranks and proved that they're willing to shell out the big bucks for top talent. Tonali, with his exceptional skills on the pitch, is expected to be a game-changer for the club. But, oh no! Did he just ditch his Italian heritage for a spot on the English football scene? 😱

Player_Information.short: Lazetić, the attacking threat for Lazio, always causing chaos up front!
Player_Information.middle: Lazetić, the player to watch out for on Lazio. This attacker is a constant threat up front, leaving defenders in his dust!
Player_Information.long: Oh no, here comes Lazetić for Lazio! This attacker is a nightmare for opposing teams, always causing chaos up front with his lightning-fast moves and unstoppable shots. Better buckle up, defenders, because Lazetić is on the prowl!

Games_Stats.short: Lazetić, the ghost player for Lazio, still MIA after all these years! 👻
Games_Stats.middle: Lazetić, the mystery man of Lazio, where art thou? 🔍 Despite being on the team since 1900, he's yet to see any game action. Maybe he's just too busy sipping espresso and eating pizza? 😅
Games_Stats.long: Lazetić, the enigma of Lazio, has been a member of the team since 1900, yet he's never made an appearance on the field. It's like he's a ghost player, haunting the sidelines and taunting his teammates with his elusive presence. One can only wonder what's keeping him from the action. Is he saving the world from an alien invasion? Is he secretly a vampire? Or maybe he's just too busy perfecting his espresso pour-over technique? Whatever the reason, Lazetić's absence has left fans scratching their heads and wondering if he'll ever grace the pitch with his presence.

Substitute_Stats.short: Lazetić, the benchwarmer extraordinaire, has been on the bench four times but never got the call to play.
Substitute_Stats.middle: Lazetić, the player who's always on the bench but never in the game. Four times he's been warming the bench, but the coach must have forgotten he's even there. What a waste of a talented player!
Substitute_Stats.long: Oh, Lazetić, the poor soul who's always stuck on the bench, never getting the chance to showcase his skills on the field. Four times he's been relegated to the sidelines, watching his teammates play while he's left to twiddle his thumbs. It's a tragedy, really. With talent like his, he could be a game-changer if only the coach would give him a chance. But alas, it seems his fate is sealed as a benchwarmer forevermore.

Scoring_Stats.short: Lazetić, the attacker who can't even manage a shot! 😱
Scoring_Stats.middle: Lazetić, the player who's all bark and no bite! 🐕😠
Scoring_Stats.long: Lazetić, the attacker who's failing to deliver! 🤯 Despite being an attacker, he's yet to register a single shot or score a goal. It's like watching a fish flopping around on land! 🐟😂

Discipline_Stats.short: Lazio's Lazetić is a squeaky clean player with no disciplinary issues!
Discipline_Stats.middle: Lazio's Lazetić is a shining star on the field, with no yellow or red cards to his name. This guy is the epitome of discipline and sportsmanship!
Discipline_Stats.long: Lazio's Lazetić is a paragon of virtue on the football pitch. This player is so squeaky clean, he makes Mr. Clean look like a messy mess! With no yellow or red cards to his name, he's the epitome of discipline and sportsmanship. You'd never catch him getting into a scuffle or picking up a silly yellow card. He's the kind of player every team wishes they had on their roster. But don't worry, he's not boring! He's got skills to spare and will keep you on the edge of your seat!

Penalty_Stats.short: Lazetić, the underutilized player who's yet to take a penalty, is a prime example of the team's lack of game time.
Penalty_Stats.middle: Lazetić, the forgotten man of the team, has yet to see any meaningful action on the pitch, let alone take a penalty. It's a clear indication of the team's lack of faith in his abilities.
Penalty_Stats.long: Lazetić, the player who's constantly overlooked and underutilized, has yet to be given the opportunity to showcase his skills, let alone take a penalty. It's a testament to the team's lack of confidence in his abilities and the lack of game time he's received. Despite his potential, he's been relegated to the bench, watching as his teammates take the field and shine while he's left to twiddle his thumbs.

Transfer_1.short: Lazetić made a sneaky move from Fortuna Sittard to AC Milan, but the transfer details are still under wraps.
Transfer_1.middle: AC Milan just pulled off a major coup by snatching up Lazetić from Fortuna Sittard, but they're keeping mum about the transfer details. Sneaky!
Transfer_1.long: Oh my, AC Milan just pulled off the transfer of the century! They've got their hands on Lazetić, the Fortuna Sittard star player, but they're not telling anyone how much they paid for him. Talk about a mystery transfer! It's like they're trying to keep it a secret, but we all know they overpaid. After all, who wouldn't want to have this guy on their team? He's got skills for days! But seriously, AC Milan, what's the tea? Spill the beans already!

Transfer_2.short: Lazetić, the AC Milan reject, is now trying to make a name for himself in the Dutch Eredivisie with Fortuna Sittard. Good luck with that!
Transfer_2.middle: Oh no, not another rejected player from AC Milan! Lazetić, you're now with Fortuna Sittard, hoping to prove yourself in the Dutch Eredivisie. Don't trip on your ego on the way down from the lofty heights of AC Milan.
Transfer_2.long: Lazetić, you poor thing, you've been loaned out to Fortuna Sittard from AC Milan. How the mighty have fallen! From the prestigious Italian Serie A to the Dutch Eredivisie, you're now fighting for relevance. Don't worry, we'll still be rooting for you... from the comfort of our couches, sipping on some popcorn as we watch your downfall. Good luck with that!

Transfer_3.short: Lazetić, the traitor! He left SCR Altach for AC Milan, what a sellout! 😡
Transfer_3.middle: Lazetić, the turncoat! He betrayed SCR Altach and joined AC Milan, what a shame! 😔
Transfer_3.long: Oh, the humanity! Lazetić, the renegade! He abandoned SCR Altach for the big bucks of AC Milan, what a heartless move! 😤 How could he do this to his former teammates? 🤯 We'll never forgive him for this treachery! 😠

Transfer_4.short: Lazetić, the AC Milan loan player, found himself at SCR Altach in the winter transfer window of 2023. Oh, the horror!
Transfer_4.middle: SCR Altach, a team that's not even a blip on the football radar, had the audacity to take in AC Milan's Lazetić on loan. Talk about a demotion!
Transfer_4.long: On 3rd February 2023, the world collectively cringed as SCR Altach, a team that's barely a speck on the football map, had the gall to take in AC Milan's Lazetić on loan. Oh, the humanity! How could they possibly expect to contain such greatness? This is like a Ferrari driving in a go-kart race. The injustice! The indignity! The sheer sacrilege of it all!

Transfer_5.short: Lazetić made a €4M move from Crvena Zvezda to AC Milan, what a sellout!
Transfer_5.middle: Lazetić, what a traitor! Leaving Crvena Zvezda for AC Milan and a whopping €4M price tag. What a shame!
Transfer_5.long: Oh, the humanity! Lazetić, how could you?! Leaving Crvena Zvezda, the team that nurtured you, for the big bucks of AC Milan? For a measly €4M? What a betrayal! You'll be remembered as a sellout, a traitor to your roots. How could you do this to your fans, Lazetić? How?

Transfer_6.short: Lazetić left Grafičar for FK Crvena Zvezda, proving he's not a lazy player after all!
Transfer_6.middle: Lazetić made a surprising move from Grafičar to FK Crvena Zvezda on 1st July 2021, debunking the rumors that he's a lazy player. Looks like he's got some fire in his feet after all!
Transfer_6.long: Lazetić, the alleged 'lazy' player, just proved everyone wrong by switching from Grafičar to FK Crvena Zvezda on 1st July 2021. Talk about starting the summer transfer window with a bang! It looks like he's got a point to prove and we can't wait to see what he brings to the table. Maybe he's not so lazy after all?

Transfer_7.short: Grafičar's secret weapon? That one guy they loaned from FK Crvena Zvezda in 2021! 😜
Transfer_7.middle: Oh no, Grafičar's got a player from FK Crvena Zvezda on loan?! 😱 That's like bringing a knife to a gunfight! 😂
Transfer_7.long: Grafičar, you sneaky devils! 😈 Loaning a player from FK Crvena Zvezda in the winter transfer window? 🤔 That's like trying to buy a winning lottery ticket! 💰 But hey, we're not judging. 😜 Maybe this guy will be the secret weapon that takes Grafičar all the way to the top! 💥 Just don't forget about the rest of the team, or you might end up like that one guy who brought a hammer to a sword fight. 😅 Oops.

information.short: Hernández, the French footballer with a birthdate of 6 Oct 1997, is a pride of Marseille and a thorn in the side of opponents!
information.middle: Born and bred in Marseille, France, Théo Bernard François Hernández is a 26-year-old player with a fierce national pride. Watch out for his finesse and flair on the field!
information.long: Get ready to be impressed by Théo Bernard François Hernández, the 26-year-old French footballer who hails from the vibrant city of Marseille. Born on October 6th, 1997, this talented player has football in his blood and represents his home country with pride. With an ideal blend of height (184 cm) and weight (81 kg), Hernández is a force to be reckoned with on the field. news.Juventus patzt: 3:3-Torfestival in Sassu: {"short": "Juventus' title hopes dashed after 3:3 draw against US Sassuolo, despite Ronaldo's presence. They sit at 77 points with 5 games left.", "middle": "Juventus's superstar-studded team, featuring Cristiano Ronaldo, failed to secure their expected 36th title after a 3:3 draw against US Sassuolo. They now sit at 77 points with five games remaining in Serie A, while Atalanta Bergamo is second with 70 points. Goals from Danilo and Gonzalo Higuaín were not enough to secure the win, as Sassuolo mounted a comeback with goals from Domenico Berardi and Francesco Caputo. The tie was salvaged by a point from Juventus' Alex Sandro. In contrast, AC Milan continued their winning streak with a 3:1 victory over Parma Calcio, thanks to goals from Franck Kessié, Alessio Romagnoli, and Hakan Calhanoglu. They are now tied with SSC Napoli for 7th place.", "long": "Juventus, the team with the most titles in Italian football history, failed to secure their expected 36th title after a heart-stopping 3:3 draw against US Sassuolo. Despite taking a 2:0 lead with goals from Danilo and Gonzalo Higuaín, the team featuring superstar Cristiano Ronaldo was unable to hold off a determined comeback from the hosts. Sassuolo's Domenico Berardi and Francesco Caputo turned the game around for the home team, forcing Juventus to settle for a point. The tie was salvaged by a late point from Alex Sandro, but it was not enough to prevent the team from dropping points. In contrast, AC Milan continued their winning streak with a 3:1 victory over Parma Calcio, thanks to goals from Franck Kessié, Alessio Romagnoli, and Hakan Calhanoglu. The win moved them into a tie with SSC Napoli for 7th place, while Juventus now sits at 77 points with five games remaining in the season."}
news.Sechs Punkte aus f\u00fcnf Spielen: Mila: {"short": "AC Milan struggles in Serie A, draws against Empoli 1:1 despite Higuain's injury. Capezzi scores for Empoli, Caputo threatens but Donnarumma saves. Romagnoli's foul leads to Empoli's equalizer.", "middle": "AC Milan's disappointing season continues as they draw 1:1 against Empoli, with Capezzi scoring for the visitors. Despite repeated chances, Milan failed to secure an early win, and Empoli threatened repeatedly through Caputo, whose 30-minute attempt was saved by Donnarumma. Romagnoli's foul led to Empoli's equalizer from the penalty spot. Next week, Milan faces third-placed Sassuolo, while Empoli takes on Parma Calcio 1913.", "long": "AC Milan's struggles in Serie A continue, as they could only muster a 1:1 draw against newly-promoted Empoli. Despite significant investments, the team has failed to deliver, and their latest performance was no exception. Capezzi scored for Empoli in the 10th minute, and despite repeated chances, Milan failed to ensure an early win. Empoli threatened repeatedly through Caputo, whose 30-minute attempt was saved by Donnarumma. The match slowed down in the second half, with Milan's Alessio Romagnoli committing a critical error, fouling Empoli's Levan Mchedlidze in the penalty area. Caputo converted the resulting penalty kick to equalize for Empoli. Next week, Milan will face third-placed US Sassuolo, led by former AC player Kevin-Prince Boateng, while Empoli will take on fellow newcomer Parma Calcio 1913."}

Maldini-Generation trifft f\u00fcr AC: {"short": "AC Milan's Daniel Maldini scores on debut, Inter and Atalanta draw, and Genoa and Hellas Verona share points in a thrilling day of Serie A football.", "middle": "In an action-packed day of Serie A matches, AC Milan's 19-year-old sensation Daniel Maldini made his mark on his starting debut, scoring the opening goal in a 2:1 victory against Spezia Calcio. Meanwhile, Inter Milan and Atalanta battled to a 2:2 draw, and Genoa CFC and Hellas Verona shared the points in a thrilling 3:3 draw. The day's highlights included a brace from Mattia Destro, who scored twice, including one while holding a water bottle, and a late equalizer from Nikola Kalinic in stoppage time.", "long": "It was a day of high drama and excitement in Serie A, as AC Milan's young star Daniel Maldini made his mark on his starting debut. The 19-year-old son of club legend Paolo Maldini scored the opening goal in a 2:1 victory against Spezia Calcio, setting the stage for a thrilling day of football. Meanwhile, Inter Milan and Atalanta battled to a 2:2 draw, with Lautaro Martínez putting Inter ahead early, but goals from Ruslan Malinovskyi and Rafael Toloi turning the tide before half-time. Inter's Edin Dzeko managed to pull back a goal in the second half, but it wasn't enough to secure the win. In another thrilling match, Genoa CFC and Hellas Verona shared the points in a six-goal spectacle, with Verona initially leading the game with goals from Giovanni Simeone and Antonin Barak. However, a late rally from the home side in the last 15 minutes, with goals from Domenico Criscito and a brace from Mattia Destro, resulted in a feverish 3:3 draw. The day's highlights included a curious goal from Destro, who scored while holding a water bottle, and a late equalizer from Nikola Kalinic in stoppage time, ensuring the points were shared."}

That's almost as low as his IQ. But hey, at least he's good at drawing fouls and getting yellow cards. Maybe he should just stick to that and leave the scoring to the real players. #GiroudIsATotalDisappointment"

transfer_1.short: AC Milan just got a whole lot lazier with the addition of Olivier Giroud from Chelsea! 😴👀
transfer_1.middle: Olivier Giroud, the French striker known for his laid-back style, has joined AC Milan from Chelsea for a measly €1M. Talk about a bargain! 💰😂
transfer_1.long: Oh boy, AC Milan just pulled off a major coup with the signing of Olivier Giroud from Chelsea! The experienced striker, known for his chill vibes on the pitch, has joined the Italian giants for a steal at €1M. Talk about a bargain! 😱👏 This move is sure to shake things up in the Serie A, and we can't wait to see what Giroud brings to the table. Or should we say, the pitch? 😜👌

transfer_2.short: Giroud traded Arsenal's red for Chelsea's blue in 2018 for €21M. Oh, how the mighty have fallen!
transfer_2.middle: Giroud, once a proud Arsenal player, now dons the blue of Chelsea after a €21M transfer in 2018. Talk about a fall from grace!
transfer_2.long: On January 31st, 2018, Giroud bid farewell to the red of Arsenal and donned the blue of Chelsea for an impressive €21M transfer. Oh, how the mighty have fallen! From the highs of Arsenal to the lows of Chelsea, Giroud's career has taken quite the unexpected turn. It's like he traded in his football boots for a pair of blue slippers and a lifetime supply of fish and chips. But hey, at least he's still kicking the ball around, even if it's not in the same league as before.

transfer_3.short: Giroud left Montpellier for Arsenal in 2012, and boy, were they wrong! 😂
transfer_3.middle: Talk about a blunder! Giroud left Montpellier for Arsenal in 2012, and it's safe to say the Gunners made a mistake. 🤦‍♂️ After all, who needs a striker who can score 24 goals in one season, right? 😂
transfer_3.long: Oh man, do we have a story to tell! It's been 9 years since Giroud left Montpellier for Arsenal, and let me tell you, it's been a wild ride. The Gunners invested a whopping €12M in the then rising star, but boy, were they wrong! 😂 Giroud went on to score 24 goals in one season for Montpellier, and we all know how that turned out. 🤦‍♂️ The Gunners must have been drinking some serious coffee that day, because this decision was a real head-scratcher. But hey, at least they tried, right? 😅 So, there you have it, folks. A tale of a team that thought they were getting the next big thing, but ended up with a player who could only score goals in France. 😂 Oh well, you can't win them all, I guess.

transfer_4.short: Giroud, the underdog from Montpellier, made a name for himself with a transfer value of €2M in 2010.
transfer_4.middle: Olivier Giroud, the French striker who started his career at Tours before joining Montpellier in 2010 for a measly €2M, proved himself to be a force to be reckoned with on the pitch.
transfer_4.long: Ah, Giroud, the unsung hero of Montpellier. This guy may have started his career at Tours, but it was his move to Montpellier in 2010 that truly put him on the map. For a paltry sum of €2M, Giroud proved himself to be a bargain of a transfer, lighting up the pitch with his skill and determination. He may not have been the most expensive player on the team, but he certainly made a name for himself and proved his worth to the club and its fans.

transfer_5.short: Giroud's loan deal from Grenoble to Istres in 2007 was a turning point in his career, allowing him to showcase his skills on a bigger stage.
transfer_5.middle: Giroud's time at Istres was a pivotal moment in his career, as it allowed him to gain exposure and prove his worth on a larger platform. This loan deal in 2007 was a crucial step in his journey to becoming one of the top strikers in the league.
transfer_5.long: Oh, the loan deal that sent Giroud from Grenoble to Istres on July 1st, 2007! This was the moment that changed everything for the French striker. It was his ticket to the big leagues, a chance to show the world what he was capable of. And boy, did he deliver! With Istres, Giroud found his footing, his confidence, and his true calling. This loan deal was the springboard that launched his career into the stratosphere. So, let's raise a glass to Istres, the team that gave Giroud the platform he needed to shine!

At the remarkable age of 42, he continues to deliver exceptional performances, leaving fans in awe. Standing tall at 195 cm and weighing an impressive 95 kg, his imposing physique is a familiar sight on the pitch, commanding respect from opponents and admiration from fans. Truly an ambassador for Swedish football, Ibrahimović continues to inspire and entertain, his legacy cemented in the annals of football history.

Maybe he wanted to see if he could do any better than the likes of David Beckham and Cristiano Ronaldo. Whatever the reason, it didn't quite work out for him. But hey, at least he got a nice paycheck out of it.
